instructions.text: Saute onions until tender. Set aside.

Combine with soup and sauteed onions. Toss stuffing with melted butter.
In a greased 2 quart casserole, layer first the stuffing, then carrot mixture, then cheese.
Repeat layers again; end with cheese on top.
Bake, uncovered, at 350°F (175°C) for about 20 minutes, or until mixture is bubbly and cheese melted.

recipes.title: Country Corn Bread Dressing
recipes.source_note: Aunt Jemima corn bread mix package
recipes.description: Traditional Southern-style corn bread dressing perfect for stuffing turkey or as a side dish.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F.
Sauté celery and onion in margarine until tender.
Combine celery mixture and remaining ingredients.
Toss lightly until bread is thoroughly moistened.
Place in 8-inch square baking dish or 1-1/2-quart casserole.
Bake 40 to 45 minutes or until heated through.
Alternatively, lightly stuff dressing into body and neck cavities of one 12-pound turkey; roast according to standard roasting directions.

recipes.description: Traditional cranberry gelatin salad with pineapple and nuts - a holiday classic.

instructions.text: Add juice of pineapple to the unflavored gelatin to dissolve.
Dissolve Jello in hot water, add cold water.
Grind cranberries in a food processor.
Add sugar to cranberries, mix well.
When Jello begins to thicken, fold in cranberry mix and remainder of ingredients.
Pour into a large mold or serving dish.

recipes.title: Cranberry Orange Pecan Butter Roll
recipes.description: Festive compound butter with cranberries, orange zest, and pecans - perfect for holiday bread.

instructions.text: Divide the dried cranberries and pecans in half. Place 1/4 cup of cranberries and 1/4 cup of pecans in a small bowl and set aside.
Combine the butter, 1/4 cup cranberries, zest and 1/4 cup of pecans in a large mixing bowl.
Place the butter mixture onto a 12" x 12" piece of wax paper.
Fold the top of the wax paper over the butter mixture and press into a log shape.
Place the butter log into the freezer for 30 minutes to harden.
Remove the butter from the freezer and remove the wax paper.
Roll the butter in the remaining mixture of cranberries and pecan until the outside is fully coated.
Refrigerate until needed.

notes: Great for holiday entertaining
Can be made ahead

assumptions: Based on 4/5 ingredients (80% coverage)

recipes.title: Spaetzle
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 263
recipes.description: Serve spaetzle (SHPETS-luh) with sauces or in soups as you would noodles. Or serve it with sauerbraten, the traditional German way.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven bring about 3 quarts lightly salted water to boiling.
Meanwhile, for spaetzle batter, in a bowl stir together flour and salt. In another bowl stir together egg and milk. Stir egg mixture into the flour mixture.
Set a colander with large holes (at least 3/16-inch diameter) on a large piece of waxed paper.

Pour the spaetzle batter into the colander. Immediately hold the colander over the pan of boiling water; press the batter through the colander with a wooden spoon to form the spaetzle. Cook about 5 minutes or till done, stirring occasionally. Drain well.
Melt margarine or butter; toss with bread crumbs. Sprinkle crumb mixture over the hot spaetzle.

notes: Whole Wheat Spaetzle: Prepare as above, except reduce all-purpose flour to 1/2 cup and add 1/2 cup whole wheat flour.
Pesto Spaetzle: Prepare as above, except omit margarine and crumbs. Toss hot cooked spaetzle with 1 portion (about 1/4 cup) Pesto for Pasta (see recipe, page 269).

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 263)

recipes.title: Homemade Pasta
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 266
recipes.description: In recipes that call for packaged pasta, substitute half of this recipe for each 4 ounces of the packaged product.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl stir together 2 cups of the flour and the salt. Make a well in the center of the mixture. In a bowl combine eggs, water, and oil. Add to flour mixture; mix well.
Sprinkle kneading surface with the remaining flour. Turn dough out onto floured surface. Knead till dough is smooth and elastic (8 to 10 minutes). Cover and let rest for 10 minutes.
Divide dough into fourths. On a lightly floured surface, roll each fourth into a 12x12-inch square (about 1/16 inch thick). Let stand 20 minutes. Cut as desired.
Or, if using a pasta machine, pass dough through machine according to manufacturer's directions till 1/16 inch thick. Cut as desired.
Cook pasta (see chart, page 278), allowing a few more minutes for dried or frozen pasta. Drain well.

To store: After cutting and shaping the pasta, hang it from a pasta drying rack or clothes hanger, or spread it on a wire cooling rack. Let dry overnight or till completely dry. Place in an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Or, dry the pasta for at least 1 hour. Seal it in a freezer bag or freezer container. Freeze for up to 8 months.

notes: Whole Wheat Pasta: Prepare as above, except substitute whole wheat flour for the all-purpose flour.

Spinach Pasta: Prepare as above, except increase all-purpose flour to 2 3/4 cups, reduce water to 1/4 cup, and add 1/4 cup very finely chopped cooked spinach, well drained, to the egg mixture. Makes 1 1/4 pounds fresh pasta (10 servings).
Herb Pasta: Prepare as above, except add 1 teaspoon dried basil, marjoram, or sage, crushed, to flour mixture.

Egg Noodles: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 egg plus 2 egg yolks for the 2 eggs. Reduce flour to 1 3/4 cups in flour mixture and 1/4 cup for kneading. Cut dough into 1/4-inch-wide strips, then cut into 2- to 3-inch lengths.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 266)

recipes.title: Herb-Buttered Pasta
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 267
recipes.description: Simple herb-tossed pasta that makes a delicious side dish.

ingredients.item: dried basil, oregano, thyme, or marjoram, crushed; dried dillweed; or caraway seed

instructions.text: Cook pasta (see chart, page 278). Drain well.
Return to hot saucepan. Add margarine and desired herb. Toss gently till pasta is well coated.
Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serves 4.

notes: Lemon-Chive Pasta: Prepare as above, except omit herb and add 1/4 cup snipped chives and 1 teaspoon finely shredded lemon peel with margarine or butter.
Nutty Cheese Pasta: Prepare as above, except omit herb and add 1/2 cup chopped walnuts, pecans, or almonds and 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan or Romano cheese with margarine.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 267)

recipes.title: Couscous and Tomatoes
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 269
recipes.description: Try quick-cooking rice in place of the couscous.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine undrained stewed tomatoes, onion, pepper, garlic powder. Bring to boiling. Stir in couscous; remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir in olives and parsley. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 269)

recipes.title: Rice Mold
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 272
recipes.description: Plain or perked up, rice shaped into a mold turns an ordinary meal into special dinner.

ingredients.item: long grain rice or brown rice

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine water or broth, rice, and salt. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 15 minutes for long grain rice (35 minutes for brown rice) or till rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Press hot rice into a buttered 3-cup mold or bowl. Unmold at once. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Parsley Rice Mold: Stir 1/4 cup snipped parsley into cooked rice.
Confetti Rice Mold: Stir in 1/2 cup frozen mixed vegetables and 1/4 teaspoon dried dillweed with the uncooked rice.
Peppery Rice Mold: Stir in one 4-ounce can diced green chili peppers, drained, and 1/8 teaspoon ground red pepper with the uncooked rice.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 272)

recipes.title: Risotto
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 272
recipes.description: Parmesan flavors this creamy rice dish.

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan cook mushrooms, rice, and green pepper in margarine till green pepper is tender. Remove from heat.
Stir in broth, water, sherry, sage, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 15 minutes or till tender.
Remove from heat. Let stand, covered, for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 272)

recipes.title: Spanish Rice
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 272
recipes.description: Classic tomato-flavored rice with peppers and onion.

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook onion, green pepper, and garlic in oil till tender but not brown.

Stir in undrained tomatoes, rice, sugar, chili powder, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, several dashes hot pepper sauce, and 1 cup water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes or till rice is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese, if desired.

notes: Mexican Rice: Omit onion, green pepper, garlic, and cooking oil. Substitute stewed tomatoes for canned tomatoes. Stir in one 4-ounce can diced green chili peppers, drained, and 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 272)

recipes.title: Rice Pilaf
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 273
recipes.description: Add a nutty flavor to the rice by browning it lightly in margarine or butter before beginning the recipe.

ingredients.item: instant chicken or beef bouillon granules

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion, mushrooms, celery or green pepper, and garlic in margarine till tender but not brown.

Stir in rice, bouillon granules, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1 1/2 cups water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 15 minutes or till rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Stir in crumbled bacon.

notes: Curried Rice Pilaf: Omit mushrooms and add 1/4 to 1 teaspoon curry powder with onion. Stir in 1/2 cup raisins with rice.
Brown and Wild Rice Pilaf: Substitute 1/2 cup brown rice and 1/4 cup wild rice for the long grain rice. Cook rice mixture about 40 minutes.
Bulgur Pilaf: Substitute bulgur for the long grain rice.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 273)

recipes.title: Baked Gnocchi
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 275
recipes.description: Baking makes the Parmesan-flavored gnocchi (NYAH-kee) extra crisp.

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan heat milk and margarine to boiling. Mix 1/3 cup milk, the farina, and salt. Slowly add farina mixture to boiling milk, stirring constantly. Cook and stir 3 to 4 minutes or till thick.

Remove from heat; stir about 1/3 cup of the hot mixture into egg. Return all to the saucepan; stir in the 1/3 cup Parmesan cheese. Pour into a well-buttered 10x6x2-inch baking dish. Chill about 1 hour or till firm.

Turn out of baking dish onto a cutting board. Cut into 3x1-inch rectangles. Sprinkle tops with the 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Place on a well-greased baking sheet. Bake in a 425° oven about 25 minutes or till golden.

notes: Spinach Gnocchi: Reduce milk to 1 1/4 cups. Cook one 10-ounce package frozen chopped spinach. Drain well. Stir spinach into hot farina mixture.
Boiled Gnocchi: Do not pour into baking dish. Cool slightly. Shape mixture into compact balls. Drop into gently boiling water. Cook about 4 minutes.
Herb-Garlic Gnocchi: Omit salt and stir in 1 teaspoon dried basil, oregano, or marjoram, crushed, and 1/2 teaspoon garlic salt with the farina.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 275)

recipes.title: Choose-a-Grain Casserole
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 275
recipes.description: Great with baked chicken or fish.

ingredients.item: chopped green or sweet red pepper
cooked rice, bulgur, wheat berries, or barley

instructions.text: In a small saucepan cook pepper, onion, celery, and garlic in margarine till tender.
Meanwhile, in a bowl combine cooked grain, cream cheese, salt, and pepper. Stir in onion mixture. Transfer to a 1-quart casserole.
Bake, covered, in a 375° oven for 25 minutes or till heated through. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 2 to 3 minutes more or till cheese melts.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 275)

recipes.title: Old-Fashioned Bread Stuffing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic sage-seasoned bread stuffing for poultry.

ingredients.item: poultry seasoning or dried sage leaves

instructions.text: In a small saucepan cook celery and onion in margarine or butter till tender but not brown.
Stir in poultry seasoning or sage, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Place dry bread cubes in a bowl. Add onion mixture. Drizzle with enough broth or water to moisten, tossing lightly. Use to stuff one 8- to 10-pound turkey. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

notes: Microwave directions available in original
Variations: Mushroom Stuffing, Giblet Stuffing, Oyster Stuffing, Chestnut Stuffing, Peanut or Raisin Stuffing, Herb and Onion Stuffing

assumptions: Based on 6/6 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Harvest Stuffing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Apple and walnut bread stuffing with wheat germ.

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook carrots, celery, and onion in margarine or butter till tender. Stir in nutmeg, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.

In a bowl combine bread cubes, apple, walnuts, and wheat germ. Add carrot mixture. Drizzle with enough broth to moisten, tossing lightly. Use to stuff one 8- to 10-pound turkey. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

assumptions: Based on 10/10 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Corn Bread and Bacon Stuffing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Southern-style stuffing with corn bread and bacon.

instructions.text: In a skillet cook chopped bacon, celery, and onion over medium heat till bacon is crisp and vegetables are tender. Do not drain.

Meanwhile, in a bowl combine eggs, parsley, poultry seasoning, and pepper. Add Corn Bread and bread cubes; toss lightly till mixed. Add bacon mixture. Drizzle with enough of the broth to moisten, tossing lightly till mixed. Use to stuff one 8- to 10-pound turkey or domestic goose. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

assumptions: Based on 9/10 ingredients (90% coverage)

recipes.title: Wild Rice Stuffing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Delicious nutty stuffing with wild rice, mushrooms, and almonds.

ingredients.item: toasted slivered almonds or pine nuts

instructions.text: Rinse wild rice in a strainer under cold water about 1 minute. In a medium saucepan combine wild rice, brown rice, bouillon granules, sage or nutmeg, and 1 cup water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat.

Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Add mushrooms, celery, and green onions. Cook, covered, over medium-low heat for 10 to 20 minutes more or till vegetables are just tender, stirring frequently. Stir in nuts, if desired. Use to stuff one 2 1/2- to 3-pound broiler-fryer chicken. (Or, add 1/4 cup water and transfer to a 1-quart casserole. Bake in a 375° oven for 25 to 30 minutes.) Makes 6 servings.

notes: Apricot-Wild-Rice Stuffing variation available

assumptions: Based on 8/8 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Bulgur Pilaf Stuffing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Hearty stuffing with bulgur wheat and turkey sausage.

ingredients.item: pork sausage or ground turkey sausage

instructions.text: In a small saucepan bring broth and Worcestershire sauce to boiling. Add bulgur. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand for 15 minutes.
In a medium skillet crumble sausage; add onion, celery, and carrot. Cook about 6 minutes or till sausage is no longer pink and vegetables are tender, stirring often to break up large pieces.
Drain. Stir in bulgur mixture. Use to stuff one 2 1/2- to 3-pound broiler-fryer chicken. Serves 6.

notes: Microwave directions available

assumptions: Based on 6/7 ingredients (86% coverage)

recipes.title: Yorkshire Pudding
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic British accompaniment to roast beef

instructions.text: After removing roast from oven, increase oven temperature to 450°F.
In a bowl combine 4 eggs and 2 cups milk. Add 2 cups all-purpose flour. Beat with a rotary beater till smooth.
Add 2 tablespoons beef drippings from roast pan to batter; stir.
Pour batter into a 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or till puffy and golden. Season to taste.

notes: Best served immediately while still puffy

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for beef drippings from roast (standard quantity)
Estimated 8 servings based on total calories
Based on 4/4 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Oven-Browned Potatoes
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Roasted potatoes cooked alongside the roast

instructions.text: Peel and quarter 5 medium potatoes. Cook in boiling salted water for 10 minutes. Drain.
About 30 to 40 minutes before roast is done (the roast temperature should be about 100°), add 1/2 cup water to pan. Arrange potatoes around roast, turning to coat.

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories
Based on 1/1 ingredients (100% coverage)

recipes.title: Hungarian Bread Dumplings a la Matt Kubick

instructions.text: Saute onions and parsley in margarine.
Place bread in pan and brown to slightly yellow, add salt, flour and stir until well mixed.
Beat egg and milk and add to bread mix; let stand until absorbed.
Bring water to boil (add salt). Make large balls and drop into boiling water.
Cook 10 minutes; drain and run cold water on.
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Cut cheeses and butter into small pieces. In large bowl, combine with spinach, cottage cheese, flour, onion and parsley.
In separate bowl, beat eggs with seasonings until well beaten, fold into spinach mixture.
Pour into well-buttered 9x13x2 inch baking dish.
Bake about 1 hour or until brown and bubbly.
Cool slightly, cut into squares.
Mix vegetables, mayonnaise, celery, onion, and cheese.
Put in baking dish.
Mix melted margarine with crushed Ritz crackers.
Sprinkle over vegetable mixture.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Rice Casserole

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients in crock pot and cook on low all day.
OR cook in 350 degree oven for 2 to 2 1/2 hours.

recipes.cook_time: 2 to 2 1/2 hours (oven) or all day (crock pot)
notes: Can be made in crock pot or oven

instructions.text: Cook celery only for 5 minutes.
Mix the rest together with the celery.
Place in pan of melted butter.
Top with 1/2 cup of butter and 1/2 cup slivered almonds.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Corn Salad Casserole

instructions.text: Cream together the cream cheese, sour cream, lemon juice and garlic.
Add the rest of the ingredients and stir.
Serve hot for a casserole or cold for a salad dish.

notes: Versatile - can be served hot as a casserole or cold as a salad

instructions.text: Beat cream cheese, butter, milk and green onion dip mix until creamy.
Layer artichoke hearts on bottom of ungreased casserole.
Mix 1/2 creamy mix with drained spinach, pour remainder of creamy mix over top.
Sprinkle with Parmesan.
Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

ingredients.prep_note: cut in chunks, peeled if large

instructions.text: Steam zucchini for about 5 minutes or cook in microwave until partially cooked. Drain.
Meanwhile, saute onions in margarine, remove from heat.
Add cream of chicken soup, and sour cream.
In greased casserole, layer 1/2 of zucchini, 1/2 of onion and soup mixture and 1/2 of stuffing.
Repeat layers ending with stuffing.
Bake for 1 hour at 350°F.
Mix yams, margarine, sugar, eggs and vanilla together.
Pour into 9 x 13 inch pan.
For topping: Mix brown sugar, milk, flour, melted margarine and pecans.
Mix and slowly pour over potatoes. Spread evenly.
Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.

recipes.title: Corn Fritters
recipes.description: Crispy deep-fried corn fritters that can be served with maple syrup or powdered sugar.

ingredients.item: Green Giant frozen cream style corn

instructions.text: Place unopened corn pouch in warm water for 10 to 15 minutes to thaw.
In deep fat fryer or heavy saucepan, heat 2 to 3 inches of oil to 375°F (190°C).
In medium bowl, combine thawed corn and remaining ingredients; stir until well combined.
Drop batter by level tablespoonfuls into hot oil, 375°F.
Fry 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown.
Drain on paper towel. 24 to 28 fritters.
TIP: Corn Fritters can be served with maple syrup or sprinkled with powdered sugar.

notes: Can be served with maple syrup or powdered sugar
